recipes.name: Pasta Carbonara
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients needed to prepare pasta carbonara, ensuring produce is washed, proteins trimmed, and seasonings measured.
2. Prepare 400g Spaghetti by chopping, slicing, marinating, or cleaning it as traditionally required for the dish.
3. Heat a pan, pot, skillet, or oven to the appropriate temperature depending on whether the dish is sautéed, baked, braised, or simmered.
4. Add olive oil, butter, or another fat and allow it to heat until shimmering or melted.
5. Add aromatics such as garlic, onions, shallots, herbs, or spices and cook until fragrant and lightly golden.
6. Add the main ingredient and cook using the needed method—searing, roasting, simmering, frying, or slow-cooking—until it begins to develop color or soften.
7. Incorporate secondary ingredients like tomatoes, stock, wine, cheese, vegetables, or sauces and mix well.
8. Adjust heat to medium or low and allow ingredients to cook slowly, blending flavors and developing the dish’s texture.
9. Stir regularly and, if needed, deglaze the pan with wine, broth, or water to lift caramelized bits and enrich the flavor.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning by adding salt, pepper, herbs, acidity, or cheese according to traditional taste.
11. When the dish reaches ideal tenderness and consistency, remove from heat and let it rest briefly.
12. Plate the dish and finish with traditional garnishes such as fresh herbs, olive oil, grated cheese, or lemon zest.
